title: Has Facebook Become A Piggybank For Regulators?
author: Seeking Alpha
dc:creator: Seeking Alpha
description: The fine to which Facebook is subject for last week’s cyber breach could reach $1.63 billion. The small share price decline since news of the breach suggests that investors don’t think regulators will dock the social media giant to the maximum extent. Indeed, Facebook’s quick and complete response suggests that the firm had in place the capabilities to block the hackers. The firm also had plans in place to beef up cybser-security. All in all, the facts of this case seem to warrant regulatory restraint Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

itunes:summary:
The fine to which Facebook is subject for last week’s cyber breach could reach $1.63 billion. The small share price decline since news of the breach suggests that investors don’t think regulators will dock the social media giant to the maximum extent. Indeed, Facebook’s quick and complete response suggests that the firm had in place the capabilities to block the hackers. The firm also had plans in place to beef up cybser-security. All in all, the facts of this case seem to warrant regulatory restraint
